metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7519 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
agent/Core/Controller/SendRequest.cpp in Phusion Passenger before 4.0.60 and 5.0.x before 5.0.22, when used in Apache integration mode or in standalone mode without a filtering proxy, allows remote attackers to spoof headers passed to applications by using an _ (underscore) character instead of a - (dash) character in an HTTP header, as demonstrated by an X_User header.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7519` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-passenger - 5.0.22-1
passenger - 5.0.22-1
ruby-passenger - 5.0.22-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: passenger package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.22-1').
